1.title: Bill Belichick, Part 1
1.plot: A look at Patriots coach Bill Belichick through the 2009 NFL season as he interacts with players and his girlfriend and reminisces about his coaching career amid the frustrations of the season and the relaxation of boating.

2.title: Bill Belichick, Part 2
2.plot: From the locker room to the meeting room, to the office, to the field--meet Bill Belichick. (Part Two)

3.title: Reggie White & Jerome Brown
3.plot: This is a story of two men who shared a profession, a team and the same fate.

4.title: Kurt Warner
4.plot: The unlikely football rise, precipitous fall, and stunning redemption of draft reject and grocer Kurt Warner to Superbowl hero.

5.title: Walter Payton
5.plot: A look at the life of 'Sweetness' and the legacy of the Bears running back, built from an unyielding 'never die easy' will that defined him from the days of running hills in suburban Chicago to his untimely passing.

6.title: Ed Sabol
6.plot: Ed Sabol took a hobby and turned it into a national treasure. As the founder and former president of NFL Films, Ed created a cinematic image that helped propell the NFL to its current position as America's most popular sport.

7.title: Mike Ditka
7.plot: A look at Mike Ditka, a Hall of Fame tight end and Super Bowl-winning head coach. He brought a toughness and hard-nosed work ethic to football that few could match.

8.title: Tom Landry
8.plot: A look at Tom Landry, the man underneath the hat, was more than just the legendary head coach of the Dallas Cowboys. He was a great innovator, a symbol and an icon.

9.title: Al Davis
9.plot: A look at the Raiders owner Al Davis. He was one of the most influential executives in NFL history. He proved to be both feared and admired by his peers on his path to success.

1.title: The Faces of Tebow
1.plot: Five former NFL quarterbacks examine the phenomenon that is Tim Tebow from five different perspectives.

2.title: Ray Lewis
2.plot: For the first time in NFL history a camera crew follows a player for an entire season on and off the field. Think you know Ray Lewis? Think again.

3.title: Tom Coughlin
3.plot: Tom Coughlin is known for being strict and firm on the football field, but very few know about the big heart inside of this Super Bowl champion.

4.title: Cleveland '95
4.plot: A look at the collapse of the Cleveland Browns in 1995 amid the bankruptcy of owner Art Modell and his decision to move the team to Baltimore, while the coaching staff would go on to enormous football success in later years.

5.title: Fearsome Foursome
5.plot: The legendary defensive line of the 1960s Los Angeles Rams, led by head coach George Allen were a dominant force on the field, and as close as brothers off of it.

6.title: Steve McNair
6.plot: A look at Tennessee Titans legend Steve McNair, who overcame tough odds, injuries, and chronic self-doubt to become an NFL most valuable player, retiring after thirteen seasons only to meet with tragedy.

7.title: Eddie DeBartolo, Jr.
7.plot: Eddie Debartolo owned the San Francisco 49ers for 23 years. In that span, his team won 5 Superbowls as well as the undying loyalty of those who played for him.

8.title: Chris Spielman
8.plot: Chris Spielman was born to be a football player, but when his wife was diagnosed with Breast Cancer he made the toughest decision of his life to step away from the game he loved for the true love of his life.

9.title: Jimmy Johnson
9.plot: A look at Jimmy Johnson, a former college coach who became one of the most successful NFL coaches with his five seasons with the Dallas Cowboys, only to see his career torn asunder by conflicts with team ownership.

10.title: John Riggins
10.plot: John 'The Diesel' Riggins was fearless on the field and a fun-loving showman off it. He knew the power of his talents and achieved the ultimate prize with a Lombardi Trophy and Super Bowl MVP title.

11.title: Barry Sanders
11.plot: For 10 seasons, Detroit Lions running back Barry Sanders electrified the NFL with unbelievable runs while putting up prolific rushing numbers. Yet just before the start of the 1999 NFL season, as one of the league's biggest stars, he quietly walked away from the game.

12.title: Marcus Allen
12.plot: Marcus Allen knew how to score touchdowns and he ran himself right into the record books and the Pro Football Hall of Fame. Through his tempestuous tenure with the Raiders to his remarkable run in Kansas City, A Football Life: Marcus Allen tells the story of a true NFL legend.

13.title: The Immaculate Reception
13.plot: Fourth quarter, 22 seconds remaining, fourth and 10 from their own 40 yard line, trailing by one to the Oakland Raiders in the AFC Divisional Playoffs, Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback Terry Bradshaw took the snap. What transpired over the next 17 seconds has been described various ways - a myth, miracle, conspiracy, crime, and a detective story.

22.title: Jerry Rice
22.plot: Following the life of the arguably the best player football has seen in history. Jerry Rice is one of those players that had forever changed the game. At a young age, Jerry had no interest in football. However, he was soon to be the best player of all time. Watching the life of Jerry Rice and his rise to fame is inspiring and will forever change how you see football.

9.title: Mike Singletary
9.plot: As one of ten children Mike Singleterry brought the lessons and family values he had learned from his minister father to the football fields of the NFL as all-Pro linebacker and one of the "Monsters of the Midway," for the Super Bowl-winning 15-1 1985 Chicago Bears. As coach, he sets. the same high standards for his players as he did for himself, not always as successfully though. Interviews with his family and teammates included.
